==Events==
* [[553]] &ndash; The [[Second Council of Constantinople]] begins.
*[[1215]] &ndash; Rebel barons renounce their allegiance to King [[John of England]] — part of a chain of events leading to the signing of the [[Magna Carta]].
*[[1260]] &ndash; [[Kublai Khan]] becomes ruler of the [[Mongol Empire]].
*[[1494]] &ndash; [[Christopher Columbus]] lands on the island of [[Jamaica]] and claims it for Spain.
*[[1640]] &ndash; King [[Charles I of England]] dissolves the [[Short Parliament]].
*[[1762]] &ndash; Russia and [[Prussia]] sign the [[Treaty of Saint Petersburg (1762)|Treaty of St. Petersburg]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; In France, the [[Estates-General of 1789|Estates-General]] convenes for the first time since 1614.
*[[1809]] &ndash; [[Mary Kies]] becomes the first woman awarded a U.S. [[patent]], for a technique of [[weaving]] [[straw]] with [[silk]] and [[yarn|thread]].
*  1809   &ndash; The Swiss [[Cantons of Switzerland|canton]] of [[Aargau]] denies citizenship to Jews.
*[[1811]] &ndash; In the second day of fighting at the [[Peninsular War]] [[Battle of Fuentes de Oñoro]] the French army, under Marshall [[André Masséna]], drive in the [[Duke of Wellington]]'s overextended right flank, but French frontal assaults fail to take the town of Fuentes de Oñoro and the Anglo-Portuguese army holds the field at the end of the day.
*[[1821]] &ndash; Emperor [[Napoleon I]] dies in exile on the island of [[Saint Helena]] in the South [[Atlantic Ocean]].
*[[1835]] &ndash; In Belgium, the first railway in continental Europe opens between [[Brussels]] and [[Mechelen]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; [[Giuseppe Garibaldi]] sets sail from [[Genoa]], leading the expedition of the Thousand to conquer the [[Kingdom of the Two Sicilies]] and giving birth to the [[Kingdom of Italy]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[Cinco de Mayo]]: troops led by [[Ignacio Zaragoza]] halt a French invasion in the [[Battle of Puebla]] in Mexico.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Battle of the Wilderness]] begins in [[Spotsylvania County, Virginia|Spotsylvania County]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; In [[North Bend, Ohio]] (a suburb of [[Cincinnati]]), the first [[train robbery]] in the United States takes place.
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[Memorial Day]] first celebrated in United States at [[Waterloo, New York]].
*[[1877]] &ndash; [[American Indian Wars]]: [[Sitting Bull]] leads his band of [[Lakota people|Lakota]] into Canada to avoid harassment by the [[United States Army]] under [[Colonel (United States)|Colonel]] [[Nelson Miles]].
*[[1886]] &ndash; The [[Bay View Tragedy]]: A militia fires into a crowd of protesters in [[Milwaukee]], killing seven.
*[[1891]] &ndash; The Music Hall in New York City (later known as [[Carnegie Hall]]) has its grand opening and first public performance, with [[Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky|Tchaikovsky]] as the guest conductor.
*[[1904]] &ndash; [[Pitcher|Pitching]] against the [[Oakland Athletics|Philadelphia Athletics]] at the [[Huntington Avenue Grounds]], [[Cy Young]] of the [[Boston Red Sox|Boston Americans]] throws the first [[perfect game]] in the modern era of [[baseball]].
*[[1905]] &ndash; The trial in the [[Stratton Brothers case]] begins in London, England; it marks the first time that [[fingerprint]] evidence is used to gain a conviction for murder.
*[[1920]] &ndash; Authorities arrest [[Nicola Sacco]] and [[Bartolomeo Vanzetti]] for alleged robbery and murder.
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Scopes Trial]]: serving of an arrest warrant on [[John T. Scopes]] for teaching [[evolution]] in violation of the [[Butler Act]].
*  1925   &ndash; The government of South Africa declares [[Afrikaans]] an official language.
*[[1934]] &ndash; The first [[Three Stooges]] short, ''[[Woman Haters]],'' is released.
*[[1936]] &ndash; Italian troops [[March of the Iron Will|occupy]] [[Addis Ababa]], [[Ethiopia]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Norwegian refugees form a [[government-in-exile]] in London
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: [[Norwegian Campaign]] – Norwegian squads in [[Battle of Hegra Fortress|Hegra Fortress]] and [[Battle of Vinjesvingen|Vinjesvingen]] capitulate to [[Nazi Germany|German forces]] after all other Norwegian forces in southern Norway had laid down their arms.
*[[1941]] &ndash; Emperor [[Haile Selassie]] returns to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia; the country commemorates the date as [[Liberation Day]] or Patriots' Victory Day.
*[[1944]] &ndash; German troops execute 216 civilians in the village of [[Kleisoura, Kastoria|Kleisoura]] in Greece
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: Canadian and British troops liberate the Netherlands and Denmark from [[Nazism|German]] occupation when [[Wehrmacht]] troops capitulate.
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: The [[Prague uprising]] begins as an attempt by the [[Czech resistance]] to free the city from [[German occupation of Czechoslovakia|German occupation]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; The [[International Military Tribunal for the Far East]] begins in Tokyo with twenty-eight Japanese military and government officials accused of [[war crime]]s and [[crimes against humanity]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of London (1949)|Treaty of London]] establishes the [[Council of Europe]] in [[Strasbourg]] as the first European institution working for [[European integration]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Bhumibol Adulyadej]] is crowned King Rama IX of [[Thailand]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; West Germany gains full [[sovereignty]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Project Mercury|The Mercury program]]: [[Mercury-Redstone 3]] &ndash; [[Alan Shepard]] becomes the first American to travel into [[outer space]], on a sub-orbital flight.
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[Council of Europe]] declares May 5 as [[Europe Day]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Alitalia Flight 112]] crashes into Mount Longa near [[Palermo]], [[Sicily]], killing all 115 aboard, making it the deadliest single-aircraft disaster in Italy.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Secretariat (horse)]] wins the [[1973 Kentucky Derby]] in 1:59 2/5, a still standing record.
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Operation Nimrod]]: The British [[Special Air Service]] storms the [[Iran]]ian [[embassy]] in London after a six-day siege.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Bobby Sands]] dies in the [[Long Kesh]] prison hospital after 66 days of [[hunger strike|hunger-striking]], aged 27.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Iran–Contra affair]]: start of [[Congress of the United States|Congressional]] televised hearings in the United States of America
*[[1991]] &ndash; A [[1991 Washington, D.C. riot|riot]] breaks out in the [[Mount Pleasant, Washington, D.C.|Mt. Pleasant]] section of Washington, D.C. after police shoot a [[Salvadoran]] man.
*[[1994]] &ndash; The signing of the [[Bishkek Protocol]] between [[Armenia]] and [[Azerbaijan]] effectively freezes the [[Nagorno-Karabakh conflict]].
*  1994   &ndash; American teenager [[Michael P. Fay]] is [[Caning in Singapore|caned]] in [[Singapore]] for theft and vandalism.
*[[2006]] &ndash; The government of [[Sudan]] signs an accord with the [[Sudan Liberation Army]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; All 114 aboard [[Kenya Airways Flight 507]] die when the pilots lose control of the plane and it crashes in [[Douala]], [[Cameroon]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[2010–12 Greek protests|Mass protests]] in Greece erupt in response to [[austerity]] measures imposed by the government as a result of the [[Eurozone crisis|Greek debt crisis]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; In [[2013 Operation at Motijheel Shapla Chattar|Bangladesh Shapla Chattar Massacre]] more than 3000 people were killed from government. <ref>http://news.priyo.com/2013/06/06/death-claim-still-unfounded-78070.html</ref><ref>http://asianewsnet.net/Bangladeshi-Islamic-group%E2%80%99s-death-missing-claim--46998.html</ref>
*[[2014]] &ndash; [[2014 Po Toi Island ship collision|11 people are missing]] after a Chinese cargo ship collides with a [[Marshall Islands]] registered [[container ship]] off the coast of [[Hong Kong]].
